name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Jerusalem

reviews.text: Hotel room was a little dirty, seems like they never vacuumed the room and lots of dust/smudges on counters. The Indian restaurant in the hotel was wonderful but the standard Israeli breakfast in the hotel lacked choices and flavor. The front desk staff was less than helpful and the ongoing construction in the parking lot contributed to the general noise level. We have stayed in numerous Crown Plazas before, and this was not up to their usual standards.
reviews.title: Crown Plaza was just OK

reviews.text: This high-end commercial hotel can have great views and is a convenient location if you are launching a tour by bus or are headed to the adjacent convention center. The staff was very accomodating and the breakfast (Israeli-style buffet ) is first rate!
reviews.title: Nice rooms , nice people!
Not An Exciting Hotel
reviews.text: stayed for a couple of nights for a wedding that was actually being held in the hotel, so it was convenient.
But the room was dated, and the bathroom tiles needed regrouting at the bath level - a job which could easily have been attended to if the maintenance quality was taken more seriously.
reviews.title: Comfortable rooms but needs to improve overall cleanliness.

reviews.text: Also the sheet didn't really fit the king-size bed, and there wasn't an undersheet, nor was the room serviced by 3.0pm
reviews.title: Beware the religion and politics

reviews.text: The hotel is near the Convention centre, not the Old City, so for tourists it isn't the best bet, and together with the tired looking restaurant for breakfast it just simply needs some serious investment. The separately run Indian restaurant in the hotel is its best selling point.
reviews.title: What a dump.

reviews.text: This hotel was not clean. The bathrooms are filled with mildew (TILEX PLEASE!!!). The hallways are in need of a good cleaning as well.
reviews.title: Good mid-priced hotel.. especially if you're 'frum'!

description: The Crowne Plaza Jerusalem hotel is ideally located at the entrance to the capital, half an hour drive from Israel's international airport and within walking distance from the Knesset - the Israeli parliament and Supreme Court with their unique architecture, also in the vicinity the museums district. the Crowne Plaza Jerusalem hotel is the tallest building in the city and an impressive land mark. All rooms have balconies and are over looking the panoramic views of the old city and new quarters with breathtaking scenery of Judea hills in their backgrounds. The hotel offers a variety of banqueting solutions from 30 to 900 participants in a theater style seminar at our modern and audio-video equipped conference hall or at a sit down gourmet function as per your request. Within a few seconds walk the biggest indoor convention complex in Israel The ICC. At the Crowne Plaza Jerusalem You'll find the most updated executive services, Club lounge on the top 21st floor, Wireless high speed Internet connection in all rooms & public areas. Covered heated swimming pool and SPA including 2 tennis courts, gym, wet and dry sauna and workout studio classes. From It's great location you are invited to walk or a drive to each of this holy city's specially characterized historic areas and get back to your home away from home at the Crowne Plaza Jerusalem.
